channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙のゲーム事業の成功により、ハースト社によるパズモ社の買収など、他の新聞社もその成功を再現しようとするが、ゲーム報道は遅れている（Nathan Grayson/Aftermath）
item.description:
Nathan Grayson / Aftermath:
The New York Times' thriving games business prompts others to try to replicate its success, such as with Hearst's acquisition of Puzzmo, but games coverage lags  —  “The ad market is terrible.  There's very real news fatigue.  There's tons of alternative sources for news that aren't even news agencies."

item.title: [スレッド】カリフォルニア・ジャーナリズム保護法は、オールデンのような大手メディアやヘッジファンドには好都合だが、リッチランド・ソースのような地元インディーズには不都合（Jay Allred/@jayallred651）
item.description:
Jay Allred / @jayallred651:
[Thread] The California Journalism Protection Act is good for big media and hedge funds like Alden, but not for indie local outlets like the Richland Source  —  Can we talk about Google and the California Journalism Protection Act for a minute? 1/

item.title: 10人以上のWAMUの現職員、元職員、契約社員へのインタビューから、DCist閉鎖に関する経営陣の矛盾した不明瞭なメッセージングが明らかになった（Andrew Beaujon/Washingtonian）
item.description:
Andrew Beaujon / Washingtonian:
Interviews with over a dozen current and former WAMU staffers and contractors show management's contradictory, unclear messaging about its closure of DCist  —  The star-crossed marriage of Washington's NPR member station and a feisty digital news publication came to an abrupt end in February.

item.title: 2022年に立ち上げられ、パブリッシャーにマイクロペイメントを提供したニュースに特化したソーシャルプラットフォーム「Post.News」が、「十分なスピード」で成長できなかったため閉鎖される（Emma Roth/The Verge）
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
Post.News, the news-focused social platform launched in 2022 that offered micropayments to publishers, is shutting down after failing to grow “fast enough”  —  Post News, a Twitter alternative that emerged in the wake of Elon Musk's takeover, is shutting down.

item.title: USAGMは、元ワシントン・ポスト紙のジャーナリスト、マイケル・アブラモウィッツ氏をVOAのディレクターに任命。
item.description:
Liam Scott / Voice of America:
The USAGM names former Washington Post journalist Michael Abramowitz as the director of VOA, overseeing 48 language services reaching ~354M people weekly  —  The U.S. Agency for Global Media on Friday named Michael Abramowitz as the new permanent director of Voice of America.

item.title: グレイドン・カーターが、自身のデジタルニュースレター「Air Mail」の延長として、書籍や雑誌などを販売する実店舗「Air Mail Newsstand」をニューヨークにオープン（Ruth La Ferla/New York Times）
item.description:
Ruth La Ferla / New York Times:
Graydon Carter opens a physical store called Air Mail Newsstand in NYC, as an extension of his digital newsletter Air Mail, selling books, magazines, and more  —  Shoe horns, lampshades and CBD-infused elixirs are among the goods Graydon Carter is selling at a new newsstand-style shop in New York.

item.title: タウンホールで、GBニュースのCEOは40の職務に影響する人員削減を発表した。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
At a town hall, GB News CEO announced job cuts affecting 40 roles, its first major round of cuts after its 2021 launch; GB News had 295 staffers in May 2023  —  It is the first major redundancy exercise since the broadcaster launched.  —  GB News chief executive Angelos Frangopoulos …

item.title: 英国を拠点とする非営利ニュースルーム「オープン・デモクラシー」の混乱の内幕。4割のコスト削減がなければ、6月までに債務超過に陥っていた可能性があると指導部は語る（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
Inside the turmoil at UK-based nonprofit newsroom Open Democracy, whose leadership team says it could have been insolvent by June without 40% cost cuts  —  Turmoil at the top of Open Democracy has led to legal letters being sent.  —  Open Democracy could have gone into liquidation by June …

item.title: 提出書類ワーナー・ブラザース・ディスカバリーのデヴィッド・ザスラブCEOの2023年の報酬は前年比26.5％増の4970万ドルで、株式報酬は2310万ドル（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Filing: Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav's 2023 compensation package was worth $49.7M, up 26.5% from the year prior, with $23.1M in stock awards  —  David Zaslav, president and CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery, had a 2023 pay package worth $49.7 million, up 26.5% from the year prior …

item.title: RSF：ロンドンは、イラン政府、その代理人、反対派グループなど、イラン人ジャーナリストに対する国境を越えた脅威の「ホットスポット」となっている（Megan Specia/New York Times）
item.description:
Megan Specia / New York Times:
RSF: London has become a “hot spot” of transnational threats against Iranian journalists, including from Iranian government, its proxies, and opposition groups  —  Iranian reporters and broadcasters in Britain have suffered physical attacks, threats and surveillance …

item.title: 1,000万件以上の仕事に関するQ&A記事を集めたリンクトインの「コラボレーティブ・アーティクルズ」。
item.description:
Sharon Goldman / Fortune:
A look at LinkedIn's Collaborative Articles, a collection of over 10M work-related Q&A articles, as many users claim the tips are low-quality and AI-generated  —  When Irene Malatesta learned that LinkedIn was launching collaborative articles last year, she was itching to participate.

item.title: 英国ICO内部草案：グーグルのプライバシー・サンドボックスは、匿名であるべきユーザーのプライバシーを損なうために悪用される可能性のあるギャップを残している。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
UK ICO internal draft: Google's Privacy Sandbox must do more and leaves gaps that can be exploited to undermine the privacy of users who should remain anonymous  —  In draft report, agency says Google's proposed replacements for cookies have gaps advertisers can exploit

item.title: 職員が組合結成に投票した後のレイオフなど、ロングビーチポスト紙で続くストライキの理由を深掘り（Ben Burgis/Jacobin）
item.description:
Ben Burgis / Jacobin:
A deep look at the reasons behind the ongoing strike at The Long Beach Post, including layoffs after staffers voted to form a union  —  Striking Long Beach Post journalists say they are fighting against layoffs, corporate media consolidation, and union-busting labor law violations.

item.title: ヒュンダイは、ある広告が反ユダヤ的で親ナチ的なコンテンツの隣に表示された後、Xでの広告を一時停止していると発表した。
item.description:
David Ingram / NBC News:
Hyundai says it is pausing ads on X, after one ad appeared next to antisemitic and pro-Nazi content; the ad appeared on a user profile that had 55K+ followers  —  The move came after a Hyundai ad appeared next to antisemitic posts from a user who has posted pro-Hitler content.

item.title: 情報筋ソニー・ピクチャーズエンタテインメントとアポロ、スカイダンスと独占交渉中のパラマウントに対し、全額現金での共同オファーを検討（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Sony Pictures Entertainment and Apollo discussed a joint all-cash offer for Paramount, which is still in an exclusive negotiation window with Skydance  —  The company and Apollo Global Management are discussing a joint effort, even as Paramount conducts exclusive merger negotiations with Skydance.
